Generation I.Red: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
Generation I.Yellow: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
Generation I.Stadium: With a body temperature of close to 2,200 degrees , its body is always burning with orange flames. Lives near volcanoes.

Generation II.Gold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
Generation II.Silver: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
Generation II.Crystal: It moves more frequently in hot areas. It can heal itself by dipping its wound into lava.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pok é mon 's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
Generation III.Sapphire: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pok é mon 's fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
Generation III.Emerald: In battle, it blows out intense flames from all over its body to intimidate its foe. These fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in the area.
Generation III.FireRed: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly amidst flames.

Generation IV.Diamond: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
Generation IV.Pearl: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
Generation IV.Platinum: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

Generation VI.X: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit .

Generation VII.Sun: When it's tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F .
Generation VII.Moon: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The hotter the place, the better they feel. Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than those in other areas.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.

Generation VIII.Sword: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
Generation VIII.Shield: These Pokémon's bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It was born in the crater of a volcano. Its body is covered with flames that shimmer like the sun.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It was born in the crater of a volcano. Its body is covered with flames that shimmer like the sun.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation IX.Violet: Wavering flames similar to those of the sun appear on the surface of this Pokémon’s body.
